Description: Fragment of lip, neck and round handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 131 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Nikasagoras. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 328.12.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (198)
